# Microsoft Club Website - Copilot Instructions

## Project Overview
A simple, beginner-friendly React website for the Microsoft Club. Built with React + Vite, Tailwind CSS, and JSON-based content management.

## Tech Stack
- **Frontend**: React.js with Vite
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS
- **Routing**: React Router
- **Data**: JSON files (no backend)
- **Deployment**: Vercel

## Project Structure
```
src/
  components/     # Reusable components (Header, Footer, EventCard, etc.)
  pages/          # Page components (Home, About, Events, Team, Contact)
  data/           # JSON files for events and team members
  assets/         # Images and assets
public/           # Static files and posters
```

## Setup Checklist

- [x] Verify that the copilot-instructions.md file in the .github directory is created.
- [x] Scaffold the Project - React with Vite configured
- [x] Customize the Project - All pages and components created
- [x] Install Required Extensions - No additional extensions needed
- [x] Compile the Project - Build successful
- [x] Create and Run Task - Dev server running on http://localhost:5173
- [x] Launch the Project - Running successfully
- [x] Ensure Documentation is Complete - README.md created with full instructions

## Development Guidelines
- Keep code simple and well-commented for beginners
- Use Tailwind CSS utility classes for styling
- Store all editable content in JSON files
- Use semantic HTML and accessible components
- Follow React best practices
